meanings.definition: To be constantly or visibly worried or anxious.
meanings.sent1: She fretted about her upcoming test all night.
meanings.sent2: The mother fretted over her child's safety at the playground.
meanings.sent3: He fretted so much about the weather that he forgot his umbrella on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The cat fretted at the window, eager to go outside.
meanings.sent5: The student fretted about the deadline, checking the clock every few minutes.

meanings.definition: To have a pattern of small raised lines on the surface.
meanings.sent1: The old table was beautifully fretted with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The ancient map was fretted with delicate lines marking different territories.
meanings.sent3: The artist fretted the edges of the paper to create a unique border.
meanings.sent4: The pot was fretted with a floral pattern, adding charm to the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The wood was fretted with age, showing the passage of time through its lines.

meanings.definition: To have a fingerboard with raised metal strips on a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The guitar was fretted, allowing the musician to play different notes.
meanings.sent2: The bass guitar was fretted for precise tuning during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The musician fretted the strings on the guitar, creating a melodious tune.
meanings.sent4: The ukulele was fretted with care to ensure accurate pitch while playing.
meanings.sent5: The violinist deftly fretted the strings, producing a harmonious melody.
